education.field_of_study: Liberal Arts and Sciences: Global Challenges

awards.title: Highly Skilled Workforce Scholarship
awards.description: Scholarship toward the M.Sc. Marine Systems and Policies at the University of Edinburgh, awarded on the basis of academic merit.

awards.title: VSB Fonds Scholarship
awards.description: Scholarship toward the M.Sc. Marine Systems and Policies at the University of Edinburgh. The VSB fund offers funding for graduate students studying abroad who have a clear motivation and drive to contribute to society. Candidates should have pursued extracurricular activities that demonstrate engagement with their community.

projects.title: Evaluation of the Stakeholder Participation Program of the water supply system in Chişinău, Moldavia
projects.description: Issued recommendations for the implementation and communication strategy of the stakeholder participation program (SPP), specifically addressing the establishment of an information campaign and how to identify the information needs of the population, the target audience, and the appropriate communication channels.

contributors.headline: Tariffs, Economic Regulation/Instruments, FAST Modelling, Stakeholder Participation, Sector Reform, WSS Social Measures

projects.title: Finding the balance between tourism and conservation: the pathway to safe and sustainable whale shark tourism in South-Ari Atoll, Maldives
projects.description: Conducted 6 weeks of independent field research in the Maldives as part of my master thesis. In collaboration with a local NGO I collated the different social perspectives regarding the sustainability of dive and snorkel excursions, specifically whale shark excursions, from within and outside of the tourism industry. In a short time frame I managed to gather information and opinions on a precarious topic in a politically volatile country. The fieldwork consisted of interviews and surveys with stakeholders from the tourism industry, the national government and local NGOs, as well as observations of the dive and snorkel excursions. The objective of my research was to define the feasibility of a marketable, voluntary standard for safe and sustainable marine (whale shark) tourism in the area.

projects.title: Knowledge Gain and Changes in Environmental Attitudes and Behavior
projects.description: Assisted with the research for a project that aimed to determine whether and to what extent an eight week intensive course on environmental sustainability results in a change in the environmental attitude and behavior of participants. Developed my statistical and analytical skills while I learned to work with SPSS.

profile_positions.title: Strategy & Management Consultant Energy Transition

company.name: Ministerie van Economische Zaken en Klimaat

profile_positions.company: Ministerie van Economische Zaken en Klimaat
profile_positions.description: Als beleidswerker bij Directie Elektriciteit van het Directoraat-Generaal Klimaat & Energie werkte ik samen met belanghebbende uit de sector aan de uitvoering van het Klimaatakkoord en de realisatie van de doelstelling van 70% hernieuwbare elektriciteit in 2030. Dossiers waar ik aan werkte waren medegebruik binnen windparken op zee, de uitrol van zon-PV op daken, de Stimuleringsregeling voor Duurzame Energie (SDE++) en de Europese doelstellingen van hernieuwbare energie.
profile_positions.title: Policy Advisor Renewable Energy

profile_positions.company: Ministerie van Economische Zaken en Klimaat
profile_positions.description:
As a trainee at the Dutch Ministry of Economic Affairs and Climate Policy I combine a fulltime job with substantive training for both professional and personal development. During the 2-year intensive programme I have the chance to work at four different departments within the government in various positions. 

In September 2017 I started my traineeship as a policy officer at the Energy Department (Programmadirectie Energie-uitdagingen 2020). This department was charged with the implementation of the Dutch Agreement on Energy for Sustainable Growth (Energieakkoord) and meeting the national energy reduction and renewable energy targets for 2020. Specifically, I worked on the implementation and enforcement of energy efficiency targets for the Dutch industry and the reforms of net metering (salderingsregeling). 

During my second assignment (March - August 2018) I worked as a Private Sector Development (PSD) Coach for West-Africa at the Netherlands Entreprise Agency (RVO.nl). PSD Apps provides a toolbox for Dutch embassies that assists them with activities promoting the creation of a business-enabling environment and the removal of trade barriers in developing countries. As such, PSD Apps help to shape the local implementation of the Dutch agenda for aid, trade and investment. 

During my third assignment I worked as a policy officer at the Dutch Permanent Representation to the OECD (Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development) and the IEA (International Energy Agency) in Paris. Here I mainly act as a knowledge-broker, facilitating and promoting the exchange of knowledge between Dutch ministries and the OECD on the topics of energy, climate change and agriculture. 

In addition to all this, I joined the trainee think tank in an effort to contribute to a more sustainable and diverse workplace. Together with some equally passionated colleagues I organize campaigns and events to raise awareness about topics such as recycling, gender equality and inclusion.
profile_positions.title: Policy Officer (Rijkstrainee)

company.name: Permanent Representation of the Kingdom of the Netherlands to the OECD

profile_positions.description: As part of the Dutch delegation to the OECD I am working on various SDG related topics such as energy (including the International Energy Agency), food, water and climate. In doing so I aim to search for and stimulate synergy between the work of the OECD and Dutch policies on these topics.
profile_positions.title: Policy Officer at the Permanent Representation of the Netherlands to the OECD

profile_positions.description:
At WakaWaka, I assisted Maurits Groen (founder and CEO) with his daily affairs: preparing presentations and meetings, ensuring clear and efficient communication between the CEO and the rest of the team, streamlining the management of various projects within the organisation, and supporting the day to day management of ongoing projects.

I was involved with various projects including the organization and management of a large scale event and a crowdfunding campaign. These experiences helped me to develop my project management skills as well as effective communication both within and outside of the organisation. 

•

WakaWaka (“shine bright” in Swahili) is a social enterprise in the business of empowering lives, with the goal to provide universal access to the abundant energy of the sun. In the past four years, WakaWaka has helped improve the lives of more than a million people who lacked access to electricity.
profile_positions.title: Executive Assistant & Campaign and Events Manager

profile_positions.description:
During my internship with Babette Porcelijn, I researched the embodied energy of products such as a new electric car, a piece of meat or a pair of jeans and conducted interviews with experts on these various topics. After gathering this factual information, I translated the academic knowledge into understandable information and practical solutions for individuals, contributing to blog posts and an informative book, which were targeted at creating awareness and changes in consumer behaviour.
•
Think Big Act Now is a research project that focuses on the causes and consequences of climate change on the level of the consumer, specifically the impact of embodied energy in food, infrastructure, and consumer products. One of the outcomes of the project is an informative book that explains the embodied/hidden energy in products and services and that gives tips on how consumers can contribute effectively to a more sustainable world (for more information, see link below).
profile_positions.title: Research Intern

profile_positions.description:
At StudentsPlus, I established a strategic plan for the promotion and expansion of the tutoring company in The Hague and oversaw the implementation of this plan. I was responsible for recruitment and hiring of tutors and communication with employees. 

Besides this, I also provided private tutoring myself for high school students who need extra support with languages or science subjects. This taught me how to interest and enthuse students, even for their least favourite subjects.
profile_positions.title: Location Manager & Tutor
